GABEAF

Faudo Control Room Music Loader
0413b118 38000000
042118D4 001C0004
//the first line will make it play only the first song id in the playlist
//the other line overwrites the first song in the playlist
//0x1C = bgm28.dsp which is a custom song

Custom Faudo Control Room music playlist

001C001D 00200024
00260027 002A0029
00280004 00040000

//makes game change all voice paths
//at boot, they must exist on the ISO
//audio/SE -> audio/SJ
//stream/SM -> stream/SJ
//stream/Visual -> stream/Visuaj
//BGM/gameover1 -> BGM/gameovej1
//also changes the credits song to always be staff_02

// All of these codes can be patched into the DOL
// either directly or by branching to unused space.

// List of 'character stats' structs
// 801EB3D8 = 0x78*ID of the character
// or structs can be found in .dol address 0x1E8398

0 - 0x1C = VS Mode and Arcade Mode
0x1D = Story Zatch easy
0x1E = Story Zatch normal
0x1F = Story Zatch hard
0x20 = Story Zatch ?
0x21 = Story Reycom
0x22 = Story Sugino   // has PAD3 set to 3
0x23 = Story Kolulu   // has PAD3 set to 2
0x24 = Story Fein     // has PAD3 set to 2
0x25 = Story Eshros   // has PAD3 set to 1
0x26 = Story Robnos 1 // has PAD3 set to 1
0x27 = Story Robnos 2 // has PAD3 set to 1
0x28 = Story Maruss   // has PAD3 set to 1
0x29 = Story Brago    // has PAD3 set to 4
0x2A = Story Rops     // has PAD3 set to 2
0x2B = Story Baransha // has PAD3 set to 1
0x2C = Story Bari     // has PAD3 set to 2
0x2D = Story Kido     // has PAD3 set to 2
0x2E = Story Zeno     // has PAD3 set to 5
0x2F = has blank stats, if following the pattern this would be Tia
0x30 = same, would be Kanchome
0x31 = same, would be Hyde
0x32 = same, would be Ponygon
0x33 = same, would be Wonrei
0x34 = Story Tsao-lon // has PAD3 set to 4
0x35 = Story BelgimEO // has PAD3 set to 2
0x36 = Story Pamoon   // has PAD3 set to 5
0x37 = Has first 2 spells, would be Demolt but has no effect
0x38 = Story Zofis    // has PAD3 set to 5
0x39 = Story Penny    // has PAD3 set to 3
0x3A = Story Byonko   // has PAD3 set to 2
0x3B = Story Laila    // has PAD3 set to 3
0x3C = Story Victoream// has PAD3 set to 2

// Struct format, it's made up of 32-bit values,
// the comment next to each member displays the values used by Zatch in VS Mode
u32 HP
u32 SP
u32 UNK1                     // zatch=5 reycom=4 affects ai?
float SP_resSpdPartnerMove   // 0.03 zatch
float SP_restoreSpeed        // 0.2 zatch
u32 spell1Cost               //zatch0xE
u32 spell1Dmg                //zatch0xA
u32 spell1_S                 //zatch0x2
u32 spell1Cooldown           //zatch0x0
u32 spell2Cost               //zatch0xF
u32 spell2Dmg                //zatch0x0
u32 spell2_S                 //zatch0x1
u32 spell2Cooldown           //zatch0x3C
u32 spell3Cost               //zatch0x1E
u32 spell3Dmg                //zatch0x0
u32 spell3_S                 //zatch0x3
u32 spell3Cooldown           //zatch0x50
u32 spell4Cost               //zatch0x23
u32 spell4Dmg                //zatch0x14
u32 spell4_S                 //zatch0x3
u32 spell4Cooldown           //zatch0x0
u32 spell5Cost               //zatch0x50
u32 spell5Dmg                //zatch0x0
u32 spell5_S                 //zatch0x3
u32 spell5Cooldown           //zatch0x258
u32 spell6_unk1              //zatch0x14
u32 spell6_unk2              //zatch0x1E
u32 PAD1?
u32 PAD2?
u32 UNK2                     //can be 0 to 5, purpose is unknown

To give an example, let's say we want to make Zeno's Zaker and Zakeruga insanely powerful.

We can use the codetype 06 to write a bunch of data to memory.
Now let's calculate the address for Zeno's VS Mode stats by multiplying his ID with the size of the struct,
and add it to the base address of all structs in memory (801EB3D8) we remove the 80 for the code's layout.

0x78 * 0x0E = 0x690

0x1EB3D8 + 0x690 = 0x1EBA68


[06][1EBA68] 00000078 <- Amount of bytes to write
00000082 00000064     <- Looking at the documented format above, we know 82=HP and 64=SP
00000008 3D4CCCCD
3EB33333 0000000E
0000000A 00000002     <- 0A = zaker's damage, so we can change it to something high, like 70
00000000 0000000F
00000000 00000001
0000003C 0000001E
00000000 00000003
00000050 00000023
00000018 00000003     <- 18 = zakeruga's damage, change it to 90
00000000 00000050
00000000 00000003
000002D0 00000012
00000024 00000000
00000000 00000000


And you get this:

061EBA68 00000078
00000082 00000064
00000008 3D4CCCCD
3EB33333 0000000E
00000070 00000002
00000000 0000000F
00000000 00000001
0000003C 0000001E
00000000 00000003
00000050 00000023
00000090 00000003
00000000 00000050
00000000 00000003
000002D0 00000012
00000024 00000000
00000000 00000000

These codes take up a lot of memory, so the best way to use them is to manually patch them in.
Or by using Dolphin's additional patching features.


// Custom song ID list (if patched with the xdelta file)
// songs with a "-" are not selectable with a code
27 = dtt menu
28 = dtt park
29 = kolulu gba
-30 = penny gba
-31 = kanchome gba
32 = demolt dtt
33 = mysterious boulder island
34 = dtt raiku kingdom
35 = dtt coll
36 = dtt snow
37 = dtt 1
38 = going back to faudo gba
39 = brago gba
40 = kasabuta gba
-41 = zeno gba
42 = mienai gba
